level.text: The Mayor shall establish a LIHEAP Heat and Eat initiative for the purpose of providing the maximum standard utility allowance to all participants.
All food stamp program recipients shall be automatically enrolled in the LIHEAP Heat and Eat initiative.
All LIHEAP Heat and Eat participants shall receive a minimum annual benefit of $ 20.01.
Participation in the LIHEAP Heat and Eat initiative shall not preclude any recipient from receiving standard LIHEAP benefits for which he or she is eligible.

level.heading: Effect of amendments
level.text: The 2015 amendment by D.C. Law 20-155 substituted “$ 20.01” for “$ 1” in (c).

level.heading: Legislative history of Law 20-155
level.text: Law 20-155, the “Fiscal Year 2015 Budget Support Act of 2014,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 20-750. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on May 28, 2014, and June 24, 2014, respectively. Returned without the Mayor’s signature on Sept. 19, 2014, it was assigned Act No. 20-424 and transmitted to Congress for its review. D.C. Law 20-155 became effective on Feb. 26, 2015.
